medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation for surgical implantation of electrodes for deep brain stimulation due to Parkinson's disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. R is a 66-year-old man with a 15-year history of Parkinson's disease. His symptoms have included motor fluctuations and medication-induced dyskinesia. Initial cerebellar testing showed near-normal cognitive function with isolated impairment. Over time, he experienced more dyskinesia four and a half months after initial programming of his pulse generator, prompting dosage adjustments. At 17 months post-programming, he exhibited irritability, anger outbursts, cognitive decline, and engaged in reckless behavior, escalating to an incident where he swung a cane at his daughter.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 15-year history of Parkinson's disease; previously untreated mild depressive symptoms while in college; adjustment disorder with disturbance of emotions and conduct; alcohol use disorder; mild cognitive disorder.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. R had been involved in a motor vehicle collision at work, subsequently retiring due to job stress and conflict at home. He has a history of excessive alcohol consumption, especially during periods of heightened agitation and marital conflict.
